Text: http://www.nbcnews.com/id/49263362 .  Thanks for the credit.  I admire your efforts.  Dellinger's "Yale to Jail" going up tomorrow.
ps: I can't comprehend how you achieve such speed.  I wonder what scanning software you use?
pps:  No details, but, I'm not expected to live many more months.  Do what you can to support some of the orphaned titles that you deem worthy, on my site.  OK?
Pls consider seeding some, is what I meant to say.

@UnviolentPeacemaker - So sorry to hear about your situation, & sure, I'll be happy to seed some of your items, though I don't have the bandwidth to do much with movies.

Scanning: I use a Scansnap S1500 sheetfed scanner and its software. Takes about 15 minutes to scan the pages to .jpg for most books. Then I process the images with Scan Tailor and create the .pdf with Acrobat.  Unless the book is troublesome it takes about 90 minutes from beginning to end.
